source:
bolton-born boxer amir khan spent his friday alongside some fellow natural born fighters as he enjoyed a family trip to a safari park in northern california .
khan posed alongside , and also fed , a rare but dangerous white tiger as well posing with stunning giraffes and sea lions at six flags discovery kingdom .
the 28-year-old was joined by his wife faryal makhdoom khan as well as his daughter lamysa as they all enjoyed some time off .
bolton-born boxer amir khan enjoyed a day a safari park with his family in northern california
khan and his wife and daughter pose with a giraffe as they enjoy a family day at the adventure park
khan feeds a rare white tiger during his time at the american adventure park in california
earlier this week khan ended speculation over his next opponent by announcing he will fight former light-welterweight world champion chris algieri on may 30 .
khan had come under increasing pressure to take on british rival and ibf welterweight champion kell brook in june .
however , khan , who was also linked with bouts against adrien broner and keith thurman , said he was already deep in negotiations to fight somebody else .
khan ( left ) has announced his next fight will be against chris algieri at welterweight on may 30
summary: Amir Khan, a boxer born in Bolton, spent a family day at a safari park in northern California, where he posed with and fed a rare white tiger, as well as giraffes and sea lions. He was accompanied by his wife Faryal Makhdoom Khan and their daughter Lamysa. Amir Khan has announced his next fight will be against former light-welterweight world champion Chris Algieri on May 30. Previously, there was speculation about his next opponent, with pressure to fight British rival Kell Brook in June, but Khan was already in negotiations to fight someone else.

summary: Bolton-born boxer Amir Khan spent a family day at a safari park in Northern California, where he posed with animals such as giraffes and sea lions. Khan, along with his wife Faryal and daughter Lamya, enjoyed the trip. Khan also announced that his next fight will be against former light-welterweight world champion Chris Algieri on May 30, instead of facing British rival Kell Brook or other potential opponents.

summary:
Here's a concise summary of the passage, covering the core pieces of information:

Amir Khan, a boxer from Bolton, visited Six Flags Discovery Kingdom safari park in Northern California with his family. During the trip, he interacted with various animals, including feeding a rare white tiger and posing with giraffes and sea lions. Khan was accompanied by his wife Faryal Makhdoom Khan and daughter Lamysa. The passage also mentions Khan's recent announcement of his upcoming fight against Chris Algieri on May 30, despite speculation about potential matches with other boxers, including Kell Brook.

summary: Amir Khan, a British boxer, visited a safari park in Northern California with his family, including his wife Faryal and daughter Lamysa. They enjoyed various animal encounters, such as posing with giraffes and feeding a rare white tiger. Khan recently confirmed his upcoming fight against Chris Algieri, a former light-welterweight world champion, on May 30, despite speculation about potential matches with other opponents, including Kell Brook and Adrien Broner.

summary: Bolton-born boxer Amir Khan spent a day at a safari park in Northern California with his family, where they interacted with various animals, including a rare white tiger, giraffes, and sea lions. Khan was accompanied by his wife Faryal Makhdoom Khan and their daughter Lamysa. Additionally, Khan announced that he will fight former light-welterweight world champion Chris Algieri on May 30, despite pressure to fight British rival Kell Brook and being linked to other potential opponents.
